lines.text: You need 40 pieces of square origami paper.
lines.text_raw: You need 40 pieces of square origami paper.

lines.text: In the next step I will show you how to make a Triangle out of a Square. :)
lines.text_raw: In the next step I will show you how to make a Triangle out of a Square. :)

steps.title: How to make a Triangle out of a Square.

lines.text: Start with a square piece of origami paper
lines.text_raw: Start with a square piece of origami paper

lines.text: Fold in half. Then unfold. (Picture #1)
lines.text_raw: Fold in half. Then unfold. (Picture #1)

lines.text: Fold the upper left corner to the first crease with the new crease starting at the lower left corner. (Picture #1)
lines.text_raw: Fold the upper left corner to the first crease with the new crease starting at the lower left corner. (Picture #1)

lines.text: Turn over and repeat step 1. (Picture #2)
lines.text_raw: Turn over and repeat step 1. (Picture #2)

lines.text: The equilateral triangle is complete. Cut out along creases. (Picture #3)
lines.text_raw: The equilateral triangle is complete. Cut out along creases. (Picture #3)

lines.text: I decided to cut a template piece out of cardboard. (Picture #1)
lines.text_raw: I decided to cut a template piece out of cardboard. (Picture #1)

lines.text: Instead of folding each piece, I traced the triangle and used an X-Acto knife to cut them out of the paper.
lines.text_raw: Instead of folding each piece, I traced the triangle and used an X-Acto knife to cut them out of the paper.

lines.text: You need to cut 40 triangles.
lines.text_raw: You need to cut 40 triangles.

lines.text: Fold triangle in half, folding one corner to another corner. (Picture #1)
lines.text_raw: Fold triangle in half, folding one corner to another corner. (Picture #1)

lines.text: Repeat with the other two corners. (Picture #2)
lines.text_raw: Repeat with the other two corners. (Picture #2)

lines.text: Fold the triangle to look like picture #1. You will have to reverse some of the folds. This is called a Triangular Waterbomb Base.
lines.text_raw: Fold the triangle to look like picture #1. You will have to reverse some of the folds. This is called a Triangular Waterbomb Base.

lines.text: Fold another triangle the same way. After you have made it into the Triangular Waterbomb Base, turn it over and press up on the center. This is called a Triangular Preliminary Base. (Picture #2)
lines.text_raw: Fold another triangle the same way. After you have made it into the Triangular Waterbomb Base, turn it over and press up on the center. This is called a Triangular Preliminary Base. (Picture #2)

lines.text: Set the Triangular Waterbomb Base on the table and put the Triangular Preliminary base on top of it. (Picture #1)
lines.text_raw: Set the Triangular Waterbomb Base on the table and put the Triangular Preliminary base on top of it. (Picture #1)

lines.text: Wrap the corners of the Triangular Preliminary Base around the sides. I flipped mine over for a better fold. (Picture #2)
lines.text_raw: Wrap the corners of the Triangular Preliminary Base around the sides. I flipped mine over for a better fold. (Picture #2)

lines.text: Picture 3 shows a finished piece.
lines.text_raw: Picture 3 shows a finished piece.

lines.text: Make 20 of these.
lines.text_raw: Make 20 of these.

lines.text: Notice the Tabs and Pockets on the module. (Picture #1)
lines.text_raw: Notice the Tabs and Pockets on the module. (Picture #1)

lines.text: To join two modules together, simply place one tab on top of the other and slide together. (Pictures #1 and #2)
lines.text_raw: To join two modules together, simply place one tab on top of the other and slide together. (Pictures #1 and #2)

lines.text: Continue joining modules to make a 5-sided shape. (Picture #3)
lines.text_raw: Continue joining modules to make a 5-sided shape. (Picture #3)

lines.text: Continue in the same way with the rest of the pieces.
lines.text_raw: Continue in the same way with the rest of the pieces.

lines.text: Finished model!
lines.text_raw: Finished model!
